section_path: Present on Admission Guidelines > Assigning the POA Indicator > Conditions diagnosed prior to inpatient admission

content.full_text: Assign 'Y' for conditions that were diagnosed prior to admission (example: hypertension, diabetes mellitus, asthma) (Evidence: pg no: 118, L27-L28)
content.summary: Conditions diagnosed before inpatient admission should be assigned Y indicator (Evidence: pg no: 118, L27-L28)
key_concepts: Y indicator assignment (Evidence: pg no: 118, L28)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign Y for conditions diagnosed prior to admission (Evidence: pg no: 118, L28)
detailed_rules.explanation: Any condition that was diagnosed before the patient was admitted should receive Y indicator regardless of when it was first diagnosed (Evidence: pg no: 118, L27-L28)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Determine if condition was diagnosed before admission
Step 2: If pre-existing diagnosis, assign Y

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient with known diabetes admitted for unrelated condition
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient has history of Type 2 diabetes mellitus, currently on metformin
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify diabetes as pre-existing condition
Step 2: Confirm diagnosis existed before admission
Step 3: Assign Y indicator to diabetes code

correct_coding.rationale: Diabetes was diagnosed prior to admission (Evidence: pg no: 118, L27-L28)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Should not assign N to pre-existing conditions
